arm_group.description: Ipilimumab Intravenous Injection 3 mg/kg for every 3 weeks upto 4 doses

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the safety of Ipilimumab monotherapy in Japanese
      subjects with advanced melanoma

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Study of Ipilimumab in Japanese Advanced Melanoma Patients

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit
        www.BMSStudyConnect.com.

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of malignant melanoma

          -  Previously-treated or untreated unresectable Stage III or Stage IV melanoma

          -  Measurable/evaluable disease per modified World Health Organization (mWHO) criteria,
             within 28 days of first dose of study drug

          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active brain metastases

          -  Primary ocular or mucosal melanoma

          -  History of or current active autoimmune disease

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 2 Study of Ipilimumab in Japanese Subjects With Unresectable or Metastatic Melanoma

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.description: In addition, abnormal vital signs and physical examination findings are also included
primary_outcome.measure: Safety of Ipilimumab monotherapy based on serious and non-serious adverse events, laboratory evaluations, dose exposure and modifications
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 12 weeks after first treatment of last subject

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Best Overall Response Rate, defined as the total number of subjects whose Best Overall Response is Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) divided by the total number of treated subjects.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Screening (Within 28 days of first dose), weeks 12, 18, and 24 and every 12 weeks thereafter for at least 1 year after last subject's first treatment (Approximately 15 months)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
